title: Missing Number
description:
Missing Number

Given an array nums containing n integers in the range [0, n] without any duplicates, return the single number in the range that is missing from nums.

Follow-up: Could you implement a solution using only O(1) extra space complexity and O(n) runtime complexity?

Examples:

  • Input: nums = [1,2,3]
    Output: 0
    Explanation: Since there are 3 numbers, the range is [0,3]. The missing number is 0 since it does not appear in nums.
  • Input: nums = [0,2]
    Output: 1

Constraints:

  • 1 <= nums.length <= 1000
solution_text:
Missing Number

Algorithm:

  1. Calculate expected sum using formula n*(n+1)/2
  2. Calculate actual sum of all numbers in array
  3. Return the difference (expected - actual)

Time Complexity: O(n) - single pass through array

Space Complexity: O(1) - constant space

Key Insights:

  • XOR alternative: XOR has property a XOR a = 0, a XOR 0 = a
  • Sum approach is simpler and more intuitive
  • Both approaches achieve O(1) space complexity
solution_code:
def missingNumber(nums):
    n = len(nums)
    expected_sum = n * (n + 1) // 2
    actual_sum = sum(nums)
    return expected_sum - actual_sum
verify:
def verify(actual_output, expected_output):
    """Verify the missing number result"""
    passed = actual_output == expected_output
    output_str = str(actual_output)
    
    return [passed, output_str]
